docs.snippet: The tugboat Brilliant, owned by the Standard Oil Company, was sunk in the upper bay off Fortieth Street, South Brooklyn, by a huge wave yesterday morning. One man was drowned. Four others had a thrilling escape....
docs.lead_paragraph: The tugboat Brilliant, owned by the Standard Oil Company, was sunk in the upper bay off Fortieth Street, South Brooklyn, by a huge wave yesterday morning. One man was drowned. Four others had a thrilling escape.

headline.main: SUNK BY A BIG WAVE.; Tag Brilliant Swamped in the Upper Bay -- One Life Lost.

docs.snippet: BELLPORT, L. I., Nov. 28. -- The four-masted schooner Louise H. Randall, Philadelphia, from Newport, R. I., is ashore at Smith's Point, opposite here. Capt. Hathorn, his wife, their child, and the crew of nine men have been clinging to the rigging...
docs.abstract: Louise H. Randall Stranded at Smith's Point; Life-Saving Service Efficient
docs.lead_paragraph: BELLPORT, L. I., Nov. 28. -- The four-masted schooner Louise H. Randall, Philadelphia, from Newport, R. I., is ashore at Smith's Point, opposite here. Capt. Hathorn, his wife, their child, and the crew of nine men have been clinging to the rigging all day.

headline.main: ASHORE ON LONG ISLAND.; A Woman, a Child, and Ten Men on a Wrecked Schooner.
RUN DOWN IN THE YAWL.; Fog and Heavy Weather Added Perils to the Lake Huron Collision.

docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 26. -- The Pacific Mail steamship City of New-York, which sailed from this port this afternoon, went on the rocks at Point Bonita in a dense fog. She will probably be a total wreck. Point Bonita is at the entrance of the Golden...
docs.abstract: City of New-York Stranded at San Francisco
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Oct. 26. -- The Pacific Mail steamship City of New-York, which sailed from this port this afternoon, went on the rocks at Point Bonita in a dense fog. She will probably be a total wreck. Point Bonita is at the entrance of the Golden Gate on the northern side.

headline.main: CITY OF NEW-YORK ASHORE.; Pacific Stall Steamship will Probably Be a Total Wreck.

docs.snippet: The past week has been an exceedingly trying one for vessels that sail in the waters of the North Atlantic. Storms, which some mariners describe as hurricanes, and others as whizzing cyclones, regardless of meteorological nomenclature, have held h...
docs.abstract: Romulus Wrecked; Crew Rescued by Cuba
docs.lead_paragraph: The past week has been an exceedingly trying one for vessels that sail in the waters of the North Atlantic. Storms, which some mariners describe as hurricanes, and others as whizzing cyclones, regardless of meteorological nomenclature, have held high carnival in that region, and as a result many storm-beaten craft have been added to the melancholy roll of derelicts.

headline.main: IN GALES AND TUMBLING SEAS; CREWS OF WRECKED SHIPS SAVED AFTER LONG SUFFERING. The Men of the Schooner Charles E. Young Lashed to the Ringing for Forty-four Hours -- Rescued by the Morning Light and Brought to This Port -- Fearful Sufferings of the Men -- The Crew of the Bark Romulus Spends Many Days in the Deckhouse with Little Food.

docs.snippet: William Smith, thirty-five years old, head stoker on the steamship City of Rome of the Anchor Line, was drowned late Friday night at the foot of West Twenty-fourth Street while endeavoring to save the life of a woman who had fallen overboard. Smit...
docs.abstract: City of Rome; Stoker W. Smith Drowned
docs.lead_paragraph: William Smith, thirty-five years old, head stoker on the steamship City of Rome of the Anchor Line, was drowned late Friday night at the foot of West Twenty-fourth Street while endeavoring to save the life of a woman who had fallen overboard. Smith had been for sixteen years in the employ of the line.

headline.main: LOST HIS LIFE FOR A WOMAN; A City of Rome Stoker Drowned During the Storm Friday Night.

docs.snippet: SAVANNAH, Ga., Aug. 30 -- The City of Savannah is ashore on Hunting Island, thirty miles off Beaufort. She is a total wreck, and is rapidly going to pieces....
docs.abstract: City of Savannah Stranded on Hunting Island; Cut
docs.lead_paragraph: SAVANNAH, Ga., Aug. 30 -- The City of Savannah is ashore on Hunting Island, thirty miles off Beaufort. She is a total wreck, and is rapidly going to pieces.

headline.main: SISTER SHIP TO THE RESCUE; CITY OF SAVANNAH RAN UPON HUNTING ISLAND. Some of Her Passengers Taken Off by the Birmingham, Others Get Away on a Life Raft and Make a Safe Landing -- Terrible Experience of Those Aboard the Ship, Who Clung for Hours to the Rigging -- The Captain Tells of the Great Storm and the Loss of His Boat.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec, 27. -- The Belgian steamer Noordland, which left New-York Dec. 14 for Antwerp, has been towed into Queenstown by the steamer Ohio. The Noordland has a shaft broken....
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec, 27. -- The Belgian steamer Noordland, which left New-York Dec. 14 for Antwerp, has been towed into Queenstown by the steamer Ohio. The Noordland has a shaft broken.

headline.main: DISABLED IN MIDOCEAN; THE NOORDLAND'S PERIL FROM A BROKEN SHAFT. TOWED INTO QUEENSTOWN BY THE OHIO -- THE STEAMER ALMOST HELPLESS IN THE STORM FOR 24 HOURS -- GREAT ANXIETY OF THE PASSENGERS -- GRAPHIC STORY OF THE ACCIDENT.

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 6. -- The sale of Washington-Madison papers, coming from the estate of J.C. McGuire of Washington, was began to-day. Historians, litterateurs, autograph gatherers, and book lovers assembled in full force. Among the local buyers ...
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 6. -- The sale of Washington-Madison papers, coming from the estate of J.C. McGuire of Washington, was began to-day. Historians, litterateurs, autograph gatherers, and book lovers assembled in full force. Among the local buyers present were Simon Gratz, M. Pollock, Frank Marshall, J.H. Lambert, William S. Baker, Charles R. Hildburn, Dr. Edward Moris, and Howard Edwards.

headline.main: WASHINGTON LETTERS SOLD.; BEGINNING OF THE SALE OF PAPER IN PHILADELPHIA.

headline.main: SUNK ALONGSIDE THE PIER.; SINGULAR ACCIDENT TO THE STEAMER MARY H. PACKER.
